file_content.text: Thank you. Never expected help like that from a stranger, so thank you.
That's the last of the wounded. Sent those that could walk on to Anchorhead, just in case.
Looks like that won't be a concern after all, Dak--look who's back.
Did you drive those Sand People off--teach 'em not to mess with our settlements?
The Sand People won't be bothering you anymore.
It's taken care of.
They're dead.
That was too easy.
Thank the stars. We, uh, passed a collection--not much, really, but we're grateful, really we are.
You need the credits far more than I do.
Use it to rebuild.
Well, then we're doubly grateful.
Just what I needed.
Folks out here are breathing easy for once. We appreciate what you've done.
We'd really appreciate it if you could take care of those Sand People for us.
Sorry to bother you, stranger, but we could sure use a hand cleaning up these dead and wounded.
What we really need's help driving off those Sand People who caused this mess!
Care to tell me what's wrong?
Is there a problem?
What's it look like? Sand People raid. Ten, maybe fifteen dead. More injured. We've gotta stop this.
I take it the Sand People are responsible for this slaughter.
This is quite a massacre.
This and every other one. We call ourselves a militia, but we let those Sand People walk all over us.
I don't think shouting is necessary.
Calm down.
Easy for you to say. We got what--ten, fifteen dead, more injured? It'll keep up if we don't stop those Sand People.
I won't send our boys into a slaughter--they're farmers, not soldiers.
So don't. But when someone who can help comes by, ask them to--'stead of getting them to play doctor and mortician.
What exactly do you need me to do?
What kind of help?
Hold on one minute. I'm not signing up for anything.
I didn't agree yet.
Jerol, how could we pay? I'm sure there's much more important--
It's obvious we can't do this ourselves. The Sand People don't fear us, and every time we turn our backs, they sweep in.
Oh... fine. It can't hurt. The Sand People make camp not far from here. If you reduce their numbers, they'll think twice about attacking again.
Why not?
They will die.
I'm too busy. [Refuse quest]
Well, there you go, Jerol. I asked. Now let's get to these wounded.
I'd be happy to crack some Sand People skulls--just shut up.
Stop arguing and I'll help.
See? I knew someone would be willing to help us.
Come back here when you've taught those Sand People a lesson.
We don't got a lot, but I'm sure the folks'll be happy to donate to anyone who gets those monsters off their backs.
I'm sorry, we got a lot of work to do here.
